trial_identification.studytitle: The photogrammetric assessment of the upper and lower limbs alignment of healthy university students
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Correlation and comparison between upper and lower limbs alignment of healthy university students through photogrammetric measurement of the upper extremity carrying angles as well as the lower extremity quadriceps (Q) and tibiofemoral angles

interventions.interventions: The carrying angle is the angle made by the axes of the arm and the forearm, with the elbow in full extension. This angle was used to measure the upper limb alignment, whereas the tibiofemoral and quadriceps (Q) angles were used to assess the lower limb alignment. The tibiofemoral angle is the angle made by the tibial axis relative to the femoral axis. The Q angle is a clinical measure of the alignment of the quadriceps femoris musculature relative to the underlying skeletal structures of the pelvis, femur, and tibia. The aforementioned angles were photographed, digitalized and quantified using the ALCimagem 2.1® software. 28 men and 31 women were recruited for this study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: In order to measure the carrying angle and the Q and the tibiofemoral angles the computerized photogrammetry method was used. The obtained photos were quantified through the ALCimagem 2.1 software.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: immediately after the angles are photographed

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS), a statistical and data management package was used to obtain the medium values and indexes of variability of different corporal angles in men and women. In order to quantify the different corporal angles the ALCimagem 2.1 software was used.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: immediately after the angles are photographed

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Presence of muscle skeletal injury in the limbs, skeletal deformities, discrepancy of limbs above 1,5cm and individuals who have suffered fracture, dislocation and previous surgery on the limbs

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Av. Nicomedes Alves dos Santos 4545 Bairro Gávea Uberlândia - MG CEP: 38411-106

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Ministerio da Educacao - Anexos I e II - andar 2 - 70359-970 - Brasilia, DF - Caixa Postal 365

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study was to verify the correlation between the carrying angle and the Q and tibiofemoral angles and the bilateral symmetry for each angle. The upper and lower limbs alignment of the university students was assessed through the measurement of the carrying angles for upper extremity and the Q and tibiofemoral angles for the lower extremity to find out whether there is any correlation between the carrying angles and the Q and tibiofemoral angles and also if symmetry between right and left sides exists.
